ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about the most important events in Korean history during the 20th century. Moreover, I learned how domestic cultural processes are intimately connected to global currents and vice versa. My literary and film analysis skills were strengthened.
I earned a general knowledge of contemporary Korean cinema and media trends.
I learned how to do film analysis, and how to learn about culture from different perspectives. At the same time, it has improved my communication, speech, and writing skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The accelerated nature of this course allowed me to study a broad selection of Hallyu cultural products. However, our class was not able to go over every single aspect of Hallyu because of time constraints. That being said, I feel that Mr. Kwon's selections of weekly discussion topics was still engaging. Moreover, I really appreciate all of the guest speakers Mr. Kwon was able to invite because their expertise helped to shed more light on a certain week's topic. Finally because many of us do not come from an East Asian Studies background, I would suggest recommending that future students read one of the books on Korean history that Mr. Kwon recommended. I think the time spent introducing the history in class could have been more productively spent on discussing that week's topic in more depth.
I think a more chronological flow might be more helpful for examining the material.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Particularly if you do not find K-pop or Korean movies interesting, I would still encourage skeptics to take this course to examine transnational cultural exchanges through the lens of Korean culture.
I will recommend it to students who are interested in Korean culture, which can help them have a concrete understanding of Korean culture within 1 month.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: This course has motivated me to continue learning more Korean history and culture.

extras.title: EALL S226E 01/FILM S339E 01 - Korean Culture Wave
